intro: Psychotria peduncularis var. ivorensis, commonly known as the Ivorian psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to West Africa, particularly found in countries like Ivory Coast and Ghana. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. The plant contains alkaloids, which have been of interest in ethnobotanical and pharmacological studies.
